title: NASA gives Crew-7 the “go” for launch to ISS on Friday
summary: NASA is preparing to launch its next astronaut rotation, Crew-7, to the International Space Station (ISS) this week on Friday, Aug. 25. The four astronauts will launch from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 Block 5 rocket in the Dragon spacecraft C210-3 Endurance, targeting liftoff at 3:49 AM EDT (07:49 UTC). NASA held a flight readiness review (FRR) on Monday, Aug. 21, and gave the official “go” for launch, after the spacecraft rolled out to the pad at LC-39A.

title: NASA, Forest Service to Share Moon Tree Seedlings, Promote STEM
summary: Education and community organizations can apply to receive a living piece of spaceflight history to promote science, technology, engineering, and mathematics: a seedling grown from a tree seed that flew around the Moon on the NASA’s Artemis I mission in late 2022.

title: NASA, Partners Study Ancient Life in Australia to Inform Mars Search
summary: NASA is working with its international partners to study the ancient Earth as it relates to Mars

title: The re-flight of a Rutherford engine demonstrates rocket reuse is here to stay
summary: "The data is in, perfect performance from the reused engine."

title: ESA’s Solar Orbiter May Have Discovered the Source of Solar Wind
summary:
The European Space Agency’s Solar Orbiter spacecraft has discovered a number of tiny jets of material escaping from the Sun’s outer atmosphere. These jets may be the long-sought-after source of solar wind. Work on the Solar Orbit began in 2012 with a €300 million contract awarded to Astrium UK. In February 2020, the spacecraft was […]
The post ESA’s Solar Orbiter May Have Discovered the Source of Solar Wind appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: DOJ sues SpaceX, alleging hiring discrimination against refugees and asylum seekers
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice sued SpaceX on Thursday, alleging Elon Musk’s space company discriminated against refugees and asylum seekers in its hiring practices.

title: NASA Shares First Images from US Pollution-Monitoring Instrument
summary: On Thursday, NASA released the first data maps from its new instrument launched to space earlier this year, which now is successfully transmitting information about major air pollutants over North America.

title: Investing in Space: The nascent market for tracking and removing debris from orbit
summary: It’s a sad irony, but an irony nonetheless, that this week the European Space Agency announced that a piece of space debris — left in orbit by a 2013 launch of Arianespace’s Vega rocket and the target of a removal mission — appears to have been struck by other space debris.
